intro: Crepis albida subsp. macrocephala, commonly known as the large-headed hoary grass, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its distinctive white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are usually hairy and linear, while the stems are erect and somewhat branched. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its showy, composite flower heads.
